thread.section_title: Luke Shaw set to look for Manchester United exit in summer transfer window – Metro
thread.title: Luke Shaw set to look for Manchester United exit in summer transfer window
thread.title_full: Luke Shaw set to look for Manchester United exit in summer transfer window

author: markbrus88
title: Luke Shaw set to look for Manchester United exit in summer transfer window
text:
Jose Mourinho could force Luke Shaw out of Old Trafford (Picture: Getty) Manchester United left-back Luke Shaw is reportedly set to look for a move away from Old Trafford in the summer transfer window after falling out of favour with Jose Mourinho .
Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss The England international has fallen to fourth choice at left-back recently, with Mourinho critical of the youngster earlier in the season as he was at fault in the club’s 3-1 loss to Watford.
The United boss now seems to be favouring Matteo Darmian, Daley Blind or Marcos Rojo ahead of Shaw in that part of the pitch, and left him out of the side’s Europa League squad altogether last week.
Luke Shaw has had an unhappy season this year (Picture: Getty) Shaw has apparently been left disappointed by his harsh treatment from Mourinho, and Squawka claim he will now look to leave the Red Devils at the end of this season.
More: Football Gary Neville: This Premier League superstar should win Player of the Year award 
Roy Keane aims another dig at Jose Mourinho - this time it involves Chelsea 
Done deal: Man United sign forward who scored four goals against them 
Manchester United fixtures Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar
FC Rostov – Europa (A) – Thu 9 Mar
Chelsea – FA Cup (A) – Mon 13 Mar
FC Rostov – Europa (H) – Thu 16 Mar
Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar
West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sat 8 Apr
Shaw reportedly feels that he may be being singled out by Mourinho, who could still harbour bad feelings towards the 21-year-old for turning him down when he tried to sign him for Chelsea during his Southampton days.
He ended up at United instead, but his career stalled last season after a horrific leg-break injury that kept him out for most of the 2015/16 campaign.
If speculation is to be believed, it looks increasingly like Shaw’s stay in Manchester will be a relatively short one.
MORE: Man Utd complete signing of Levent Gundogan following trial
